body:
### Problem

This may be related in some way to: #23347

I've noticed that sometimes when starting up a rust project, Neovim will crash. This is not consistently happening and I don't believe it to be anything in my configs. Here is one of the logs


### Steps to reproduce

Neovim configs are here: https://github.com/wonbyte/.dotfiles/tree/main/nvim/.config/nvim
Sample project it crashes on: https://github.com/wonbyte/crispy-winner

What's also odd is this doesn't occur with any other LSP server I have e.g. `gopls`, `typescript`, `python-lsp`, `lua` etc..

### Expected behavior

neovim should not crash

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.9.0 (homebrew)

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

i only use neovim

### Operating system/version

macOS 13.3.1

### Terminal name/version

Kitty (homebrew)

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-kitty

### Installation

macOS homebrew

It does occur often

It appears that the size of the Rust project has an impact on the performance of the Language Server Protocol (LSP). When creating a new project from scratch, there are no noticeable issues. However, as the project size grows larger, the LSP may start to experience difficulties.

I'm not sure if it's related, but I have noticed some irregularities while using Neovim in a Rust project. Here are my findings:

While LSP for Rust is disabled the cpu usage is normal:

![without LSP](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/428611/236516460-75f161d8-f951-4c11-88aa-61fbaac0e151.png)

While running with LSP enabled, after a while that rust-analyzer is finished initialising, I can see high cpu usage:

![while LSP is running](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/428611/236516611-bf557280-0e35-48ce-87ab-9c4a0660042c.png)

If I stop LSP afterwards, I still get high cpu usage:

![after LSP stops](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/428611/236516684-7dd5f75c-d1cb-481b-a3bb-894d5c1654b4.png)

I have tried and disabled every autocmds, tree-sitter, cmp and its friends (basically anything LSP related), but the cpu usage was higher than usual.

On my setup, Gopls works as expected with low cpu usage.

Looking at your crash report I guess it has nothing to do with lsp. On my mac I can't  reproduce .  Please do not provide complex configurations. You need to provide a minimal re-step and configuration. Usually minimized. rust_analyzer uses arena allocators. This means it does not free the allocated memory.
It looks like this might be a recurrence of #8075
Closing as stale until more information is provided.

labels.description: We need minimal steps to reproduce the issue
labels.name: needs:repro

labels.description: issue reporting a crash or segfault
labels.name: bug-crash

title: Starting rust analyzer occasionally causes neovim to crash.
